intro: Spilotantha dalstroemii, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple, typically during the summer months. The plant has a low-growing, sprawling habit with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and limited water availability. Spilotantha dalstroemii plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in sandy or rocky habitats.
